infodynamics.measures.discrete
Class EntropyCalculator

java.lang.Object
  infodynamics.measures.discrete.InfoMeasureCalculator
      infodynamics.measures.discrete.EntropyCalculator
All Implemented Interfaces:
SingleAgentMeasure
Direct Known Subclasses:
BlockEntropyCalculator
public class EntropyCalculator
extends InfoMeasureCalculator
implements SingleAgentMeasure

Univariate entropy calculator

Usage:

  1. Continuous accumulation of observations. Call:
    1. initialise();
    2. then supply the observations using any of the addObservations() methods (several times over), e.g. addObservations(int[][]);
    3. then when all observations have been added, call any of the compute methods (several times over), e.g.: computeLocalFromPreviousObservations(int[][])
  2. Standalone mode. Call:
    1. one of the standalone methods which supply observations and compute at once, e.g. computeAverageLocal(int[][]).

TODO Add method calls for single dimensional arrays

Author:
Joseph Lizier

initialise

public void initialise()
Initialise calculator, preparing to take observation sets in Should be called prior to any of the addObservations() methods. You can reinitialise without needing to create a new object.

addObservations

public void addObservations(int[][] states)
Add observations in to our estimates of the pdfs. This call suitable only for homogeneous agents, as all agents will contribute to single pdfs.

Specified by:
addObservations in interface SingleAgentMeasure
Parameters:
states - 1st index is time, 2nd index is agent number
